item.title: Iran welcomes conditional release of Iranian student in France
item.description:
DUBAI (Reuters) -Iran welcomed the conditional release of an Iranian student from French prison, the country's Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday, adding Tehran will strive for her full release.

Iran has accused France of arbitrarily detaining Mahdieh Esfandiari, a student living in the French city of Lyon, who was arrested this year over anti-Israel social media posts.

item.title: Trump's back channel to Hamas says militants could cede heavy weapons in disarmament deal
item.description: <!-- THEME DEBUG --> <!-- THEME HOOK: 'views_view_field' --> <!-- BEGIN OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' --> Bishara Bahbah says he recently relayed messages between the Trump administration and Hamas concerning the handover of the deceased hostages. <!-- END OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' -->

item.title: Syria targets francophone jihadis as Sharaa navigates Western pressure
item.description: <!-- THEME DEBUG --> <!-- THEME HOOK: 'views_view_field' --> <!-- BEGIN OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' --> Government troops encircled a francophone militant camp as authorities negotiate the surrender of its leader amid broader concerns over foreign fighters and regional security. <!-- END OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' -->

item.title: Gaza truce plan insufficient against 'genocide': UN's Albanese
item.description:
UN rights expert Francesca Albanese on Wednesday criticised a US-brokered ceasefire plan in Gaza as insufficient to address what she called a "genocide" of the Palestinian people by the United States and Israel.

A fragile truce is in place as part of a deal to end two years of the Israel-Hamas war, which also involves the recovery of hostages, delivery of more aid to Gaza and eventual rebuilding of the devastated Palestinian territory.

item.title: Iraq's security chief visits Iran, steps up border and railway cooperation: What to know
item.description: <!-- THEME DEBUG --> <!-- THEME HOOK: 'views_view_field' --> <!-- BEGIN OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' --> Iraqi national security adviser Qasim al-Araji’s trip to Iran focused on efforts to deal with Kurdish groups on the border and a much-delayed railway linkage between the two countries. <!-- END OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' -->

item.title: Iran's state TV doxxes journalists in Israel as post-war spy hunt intensifies
item.description: <!-- THEME DEBUG --> <!-- THEME HOOK: 'views_view_field' --> <!-- BEGIN OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' --> Since its June war with Israel, Iran has executed at least 9 people on charges of espionage. <!-- END OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' -->
